titleInfo.title: Letter from William Valgar, Commander of the ship Colonel Macauleyto James Orton, in charge of the Bushire Residency

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing two letters to be forwarded to the captain of the ship Mercuryand requesting assistance in receiving the protection they ask for. The letters are included and consist of the following:A letter from W Valgar to the commander of the ship Mercury, dated 20 June, explaining that his own ship (the Colonel Macauley) has been assessed as in too poor condition to continue to Bussora [Basra] as intended and requesting convoy until Bombay.A letter to W Valgar, commander of the ship Macauley, dated 19 June 1816, stating that his ship is unfit for further voyage. This letter is signed by C F Grew, lieutenant, Thomas Car, caulker, William Smith, boatsman, and Basteer Souz, carpenter.
